forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 45 overnight. Southeast wind 5 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10am. Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. East northeast wind 1 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle curtain of clouds wraps the city, promising rain in the early hours. With temperatures hiccuping around the 43-degree mark and expected to rise slightly, there’s a damp chill in the air. The southeast wind whispers its presence, nudging the remnants of daylight into twilight, while the prospect of a light drizzle looms just beyond the horizon. You might sense the city's heartbeat quieting, enveloped by a soft haze that hints at moisture but is yet to fully manifest.

Looking ahead to Wednesday, expect the rain to make its debut, gently falling after the morning hours. Though partly sunny intervals may dance through the clouds, that high of 55 degrees will wane as the afternoon progresses. It's a day best approached with layers; a reliable jacket should keep you cozy against the breeze while a light sweater will serve well as warmth gives way to coolness. Perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero, where the distant clinks of evening sails mingle with the calming sound of waves, would be a fitting escape. Or venture into one of the cozy cafés for a warm drink, where the outside drumming of rain becomes a soothing backdrop to quiet conversation.
